abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Agricultural Research Management (ARM)
            Project in Indonesia. The main objective of the ARM Project
            was to increase the efficiency and relevance of the
            agricultural research system for continued and sustained
            agricultural development. Bank's performance was
            satisfactory. The Borrower's performance was
            satisfactory. The key lessons learned were as follows: (i) a
            focus on improving the management of the research system, in
            addition to the technical aspects of the research process,
            ensures that the approach is systematic and reduces the lag
            time between technology generation and transfer and eventual
            adoption by farmers; (ii) decentralized planning would
            ensure participation of farmers and other stakeholder in the
            research process; (iii) the research management procedures
            and tools adopted by Agency for Agricultural Research and
            Development (AARD) through this Project need to be further
            fine-tuned to meet the specific needs of its work units; and
            (iv) to improve the monitoring of project activities and
            their outputs, the key performance indicators must be set up
            at the beginning of the project to measure the impact over time.
